metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2893 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The GetHTMLRunDir function in the scan-build utility in Clang 3.5 and earlier allows local users to obtain sensitive information or overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on temporary directories with predictable names.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2893` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

clang-3.6 - 1:3.6-2ubuntu1~trusty1
clang-3.6-examples - 1:3.6-2ubuntu1~trusty1
clang-format-3.6 - 1:3.6-2ubuntu1~trusty1
clang-modernize-3.6 - 1:3.6-2ubuntu1~trusty1
cpp11-migrate-3.6 - 1:3.6-2ubuntu1~trusty1
libclang1-3.6 - 1:3.6-2ubuntu1~trusty1
liblldb-3.6 - 1:3.6-2ubuntu1~trusty1
libllvm3.6 - 1:3.6-2ubuntu1~trusty1
lldb-3.6 - 1:3.6-2ubuntu1~trusty1
llvm-3.6 - 1:3.6-2ubuntu1~trusty1
llvm-3.6-examples - 1:3.6-2ubuntu1~trusty1
llvm-3.6-runtime - 1:3.6-2ubuntu1~trusty1
llvm-3.6-tools - 1:3.6-2ubuntu1~trusty1
python-clang-3.6 - 1:3.6-2ubuntu1~trusty1
python-lldb-3.6 - 1:3.6-2ubuntu1~trusty1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: llvm-toolchain-3.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
llvm-toolchain-3.4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
llvm-toolchain-3.6 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.6-2ubuntu1~trusty1').
llvm-toolchain-snapshot: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
